Params: Although the three Cerberus members have fought together before occasionally, their fights have never felt as good as this time—
Have we not fought together like this enough in the past?
I suppose. We were usually assigned to assist other teams.
Can I bring some souvenirs back, Captain?
Hm? Sure. No one else is here.
No. 21 grabs a few Corrupted parts that are bending at weird angles. There is rarely anyone visiting the no man's land, so the parts here are pretty old.
And because this is no man's land, the Punishing Virus concentration here is relatively low, and there is less Punishing Virus inside the Corrupted here than those in the Punishing-afflicted areas.
Nothing like a fight, am I right, Captain?
Isn't this much better? You can only punch sandbags on Babylonia when you're upset, and they never feel as good as the faces of actual enemies.
You're so right. I gotta ask WGAA to make a batch of sandbags with your face on them. I'm sure I'll get a real kick out of them.
Shellhead Noctis is now sandbag Noctis. Sandbag, sandbag...
And so, the three Cerberus members walk back to the mechanic's shop, chattering on an empty field.
By the time they are back, the sun has fully set below the horizon. Lit by a few spotlights, their car sits outside of the shop, its engine running.
Not bad, not bad. We've sorted out your troubles. They were just a few goons.
Oh? You've... taken care of it? Just like that?
No. 21 puts the parts she took into the trunk. The owner instinctively dodges No. 21's sharp claws and the machines that still have a hint of the Punishing Virus on them.
Underneath the dim spotlights, Noctis and No. 21 are paying all their attention to the now repaired and excessively "decorated" car.
The owner nervously wipes his hands with a towel that is barely any cleaner, smiling awkwardly.
I won't delay the three of you any longer, then. See you... around.
Sorry. I meant to say... goodbye.
A fixed car better not break down... better not.
